What does the "address" field represent in a Verus transaction?
The "address" field in a Verus transaction represents the destination address and optionally the chain or system after the "@" symbol.

ng, required) The address and optionally chain/system after the "@" as a system specific destination
   "refundto":"dest"  (string, optional) For pre-conversions, this is where refunds will go, defaults to fromaddress
   "memo":memo      (string, optional) If destination is a zaddr (not supported on testnet), a string message (not hexadecimal) to include.
   "data":"dataobject", (object, optional) (for data-only outputs with no other function) stores large, optionally signed data in one or more outputs.
   "preconvert":"false", (bool, optional) convert to currency at market price (default=false), only works if transaction is mined before start of currency
   "burn":"false",   (bool, optional) destroy the currency and subtract it from the supply. Currency must be a token.
   "mintnew":"false",  (bool, optional) if the transaction is sent from the currency ID of a centralized currency, this creates new currency to send
  }, ... ]
3. "minconf"         (numeric, optional, default=1) only use funds confirmed at least this many times.
4. "feeamount"        (number, optional) specific fee amount requested instead of default miner's fee
./raw_text_input_api_text/sendcurrency
What is the purpose of the "refundto" field in a Verus transaction?
The "refundto" field in a Verus transaction specifies where refunds will go in case of a pre-conversion. If not specified, it defaults to the "fromaddress".

ng, required) The address and optionally chain/system after the "@" as a system specific destination
   "refundto":"dest"  (string, optional) For pre-conversions, this is where refunds will go, defaults to fromaddress
   "memo":memo      (string, optional) If destination is a zaddr (not supported on testnet), a string message (not hexadecimal) to include.
   "data":"dataobject", (object, optional) (for data-only outputs with no other function) stores large, optionally signed data in one or more outputs.
   "preconvert":"false", (bool, optional) convert to currency at market price (default=false), only works if transaction is mined before start of currency
   "burn":"false",   (bool, optional) destroy the currency and subtract it from the supply. Currency must be a token.
   "mintnew":"false",  (bool, optional) if the transaction is sent from the currency ID of a centralized currency, this creates new currency to send
  }, ... ]
3. "minconf"         (numeric, optional, default=1) only use funds confirmed at least this many times.
4. "feeamount"        (number, optional) specific fee amount requested instead of default miner's fee
./raw_text_input_api_text/sendcurrency
What is the "memo" field used for in a Verus transaction?
The "memo" field in a Verus transaction is used to include a string message (not hexadecimal) when the destination is a zaddr (not supported on testnet).

ng, required) The address and optionally chain/system after the "@" as a system specific destination
   "refundto":"dest"  (string, optional) For pre-conversions, this is where refunds will go, defaults to fromaddress
   "memo":memo      (string, optional) If destination is a zaddr (not supported on testnet), a string message (not hexadecimal) to include.
   "data":"dataobject", (object, optional) (for data-only outputs with no other function) stores large, optionally signed data in one or more outputs.
   "preconvert":"false", (bool, optional) convert to currency at market price (default=false), only works if transaction is mined before start of currency
   "burn":"false",   (bool, optional) destroy the currency and subtract it from the supply. Currency must be a token.
   "mintnew":"false",  (bool, optional) if the transaction is sent from the currency ID of a centralized currency, this creates new currency to send
  }, ... ]

4. "feeamount"        (number, optional) specific fee amount requested instead of default miner's fee

What is the "data" field used for in a Verus transaction?
The "data" field in a Verus transaction is used to store large, optionally signed data in one or more outputs, typically for data-only outputs with no other function.

ng, required) The address and optionally chain/system after the "@" as a system specific destination
   "refundto":"dest"  (string, optional) For pre-conversions, this is where refunds will go, defaults to fromaddress
   "memo":memo      (string, optional) If destination is a zaddr (not supported on testnet), a string message (not hexadecimal) to include.
   "data":"dataobject", (object, optional) (for data-only outputs with no other function) stores large, optionally signed data in one or more outputs.
   "preconvert":"false", (bool, optional) convert to currency at market price (default=false), only works if transaction is mined before start of currency
   "burn":"false",   (bool, optional) destroy the currency and subtract it from the supply. Currency must be a token.
   "mintnew":"false",  (bool, optional) if the transaction is sent from the currency ID of a centralized currency, this creates new currency to send
  }, ... ]
3. "minconf"         (numeric, optional, default=1) only use funds confirmed at least this many times.
4. "feeamount"        (number, optional) specific fee amount requested instead of default miner's fee

What is the "preconvert" field used for in a Verus transaction?
The "preconvert" field in a Verus transaction is a boolean option that allows converting to a currency at market price. This only works if the transaction is mined before the start of the currency.

ng, required) The address and optionally chain/system after the "@" as a system specific destination
   "refundto":"dest"  (string, optional) For pre-conversions, this is where refunds will go, defaults to fromaddress
   "memo":memo      (string, optional) If destination is a zaddr (not supported on testnet), a string message (not hexadecimal) to include.
   "data":"dataobject", (object, optional) (for data-only outputs with no other function) stores large, optionally signed data in one or more outputs.
   "preconvert":"false", (bool, optional) convert to currency at market price (default=false), only works if transaction is mined before start of currency
   "burn":"false",   (bool, optional) destroy the currency and subtract it from the supply. Currency must be a token.
   "mintnew":"false",  (bool, optional) if the transaction is sent from the currency ID of a centralized currency, this creates new currency to send
  }, ... ]
3. "minconf"         (numeric, optional, default=1) only use funds confirmed at least this many times.
4. "feeamount"        (number, optional) specific fee amount requested instead of default miner's fee
./raw_text_input_api_text/sendcurrency
What is the "burn" field used for in a Verus transaction?
The "burn" field in a Verus transaction is a boolean option that allows destroying the currency and subtracting it from the supply. This only works for tokens.

ng, required) The address and optionally chain/system after the "@" as a system specific destination
   "refundto":"dest"  (string, optional) For pre-conversions, this is where refunds will go, defaults to fromaddress
   "memo":memo      (string, optional) If destination is a zaddr (not supported on testnet), a string message (not hexadecimal) to include.
   "data":"dataobject", (object, optional) (for data-only outputs with no other function) stores large, optionally signed data in one or more outputs.
   "preconvert":"false", (bool, optional) convert to currency at market price (default=false), only works if transaction is mined before start of currency
   "burn":"false",   (bool, optional) destroy the currency and subtract it from the supply. Currency must be a token.
   "mintnew":"false",  (bool, optional) if the transaction is sent from the currency ID of a centralized currency, this creates new currency to send
  }, ... ]
3. "minconf"         (numeric, optional, default=1) only use funds confirmed at least this many times.
4. "feeamount"        (number, optional) specific fee amount requested instead of default miner's fee
./raw_text_input_api_text/sendcurrency
What is the "mintnew" field used for in a Verus transaction?
The "mintnew" field in a Verus transaction is a boolean option that allows creating new currency to send if the transaction is sent from the currency ID of a centralized currency.

ng, required) The address and optionally chain/system after the "@" as a system specific destination
   "refundto":"dest"  (string, optional) For pre-conversions, this is where refunds will go, defaults to fromaddress
   "memo":memo      (string, optional) If destination is a zaddr (not supported on testnet), a string message (not hexadecimal) to include.
   "data":"dataobject", (object, optional) (for data-only outputs with no other function) stores large, optionally signed data in one or more outputs.
   "preconvert":"false", (bool, optional) convert to currency at market price (default=false), only works if transaction is mined before start of currency
   "burn":"false",   (bool, optional) destroy the currency and subtract it from the supply. Currency must be a token.
   "mintnew":"false",  (bool, optional) if the transaction is sent from the currency ID of a centralized currency, this creates new currency to send
  }, ... ]
3. "minconf"         (numeric, optional, default=1) only use funds confirmed at least this many times.
4. "feeamount"        (number, optional) specific fee amount requested instead of default miner's fee

What is the "minconf" field used for in a Verus transaction?
The "minconf" field in a Verus transaction is an optional numeric field that specifies the minimum number of confirmations required for funds to be used. The default value is 1.

ng, required) The address and optionally chain/system after the "@" as a system specific destination
   "refundto":"dest"  (string, optional) For pre-conversions, this is where refunds will go, defaults to fromaddress
   "memo":memo      (string, optional) If destination is a zaddr (not supported on testnet), a string message (not hexadecimal) to include.
   "data":"dataobject", (object, optional) (for data-only outputs with no other function) stores large, optionally signed data in one or more outputs.
   "preconvert":"false", (bool, optional) convert to currency at market price (default=false), only works if transaction is mined before start of currency
   "burn":"false",   (bool, optional) destroy the currency and subtract it from the supply. Currency must be a token.
   "mintnew":"false",  (bool, optional) if the transaction is sent from the currency ID of a centralized currency, this creates new currency to send
  }, ... ]
3. "minconf"         (numeric, optional, default=1) only use funds confirmed at least this many times.
4. "feeamount"        (number, optional) specific fee amount requested instead of default miner's fee

What is the "feeamount" field used for in a Verus transaction?
The "feeamount" field in a Verus transaction is an optional field that allows specifying a specific fee amount instead of using the default miner's fee.
